Le premier FPS réellement scripté, un jeu incontournable.

Gioco dei primi anni del 2000 che tutt'ora, a più di 10 anni dalla sua uscita, riscuote un successo senza fine. Half life 2 parla del ritorno di Gordon Freeman, l'eroe che molti anni prima si occupò dell'incidente a Black Mesa.
Da quando avremo in mano il simbolico piede di porco, il gioco comincerà a prendere una piega veloce facendo in modo che il giocatore possa concentrarsi e divertirsi mentre la storia del gioco si sviluppa. Il Gameplay cambia leggermente con il cambiare delle zone di gioco, il cui avviene molto spesso e in modi inaspettati, passando da azione pura a piccoli puzzle, senza causare quel senso di noia nel giocatore.

FPS con un'ambientazione ben riuscita e una storia che ci coinvolge per almeno 20 ore di gioco.

I bought Half-Life 2 at a dsicount during the Winter sale for $2.50. That being said, and me having played it for almost nine hours in two days, I would say it is worth much more. The graphics are excellent, especially for a game released in 2004. The storyline is also great, full of suprises, and a bit creepy at parts (in a good way!). However, my only major issue is that some events of the game seem to drag on longer than they should. Overall this game is awesome, and I recommend it to everyone.

Pros:
-Smooth gameplay
-Narrative is all presented in-game, which makes for some pretty immersive storytelling
-Lots of puzzles are balanced well with heart-pumping combat
-Amazing character animation.

Cons:
-Voice acting is stuck between sub-par and good.
-music can get annoying
-There's a loading screen almost every 5 freaking minutes,
-the Graphics, while mind-blowing back in 2004, aren't really all that anymore.

Whether you see it as spending $9.99 for an awesome game,
or $9.99 for access to the Source engine.
both are reasons to get this game ASAP.

Fallout 3 is an action role-playing open world video game developed by Bethesda Game Studios, and is the third major installment in the Fallout series. The game was released in North America, Europe and Australia in October 2008, and in Japan in December 2008 for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.

Fallout 3 takes place in the year 2277, 36 years after the setting of Fallout 2 and 200 years after the nuclear apocalypse that devastated the game's world, in a future where international conflicts between the United States and China culminated in a Sino-American war in 2077, due to the scarcity of petroleum reserves that ran the economies of both countries. The player character is an inhabitant of Vault 101, a survival shelter designed to protect up to 1,000 humans from the nuclear fallout. When the player character's father disappears under mysterious circumstances, the leader of the Vault initiates martial law and sends security forces after the player, who is forced to escape from the Vault and journey into the ruins of Washington, D.C. to track their father down. Along the way the player is assisted by a number of human survivors and must battle myriad enemies that inhabit the area, now known as the "Capital Wasteland".

Fallout 3 was critically acclaimed and received a number of Game of the Year awards, praising the game's open-ended gameplay and flexible character-leveling system. The NPD Group estimated that Fallout 3 sold over 610,000 units during its initial month of release in October 2008, performing better than Bethesda Softworks' previous game The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, which sold nearly 500,000 units in its first month. The game has received post-launch support with Bethesda releasing five downloadable add-ons. The game received controversy upon release, including the use of and the ability to be addicted to morphine and other drugs including alcohol in the game for Australia, religious and cultural sentiments in India over the cattle in the game being called Brahmin, and sensitivity in Japan due to a weapon that launches mini nuclear bombs called the "Fat Man" and a quest involving the detonation/disarming of an atomic bomb.

This is a very challenging game that i think would be suitable for challenging players, and if you haven't got this game (which alot of people have) then if i were you i would get it. Half Life's also known to be one of the most popular (possibly even the most popular) game that Valve made. If you get this game i hope my recommendation helped you realise what my point is about this game, i also hope anyone who is new to the game enjoy's it. :)

This is without a doubt the best singleplayer shooter i have ever played. Half life 2 is so good that I still play it every once in a while. Right now i have 43.7 hours on record according to steam, while the story is about 7-8 hours if you are playing for the first time. 

The arsenal is amazing, no matter what playstyle you like, there is a weapon to match it, although you shouldn't rambo in on a strider with a crowbar. From human-made weapons to scientific experimental weapons with alien and bio weaponry along the way. The gravity gun is most notable however. No matter where you go, you can always kick some ass by blasting almost anything around you in your enemy's face. They made a desk their cover? Desk in the face! 

I once bought it after I played through portal and portal 2. I was a fan, and wanted to know how the borealis tied in to the half life story. I thought it was nothing special. After that i bought the rest of the whole series, including half life 1 spin-offs. I must have played half life 2 and it's episodes at last 10 times each, from beginning to the end. 

The story holds on to you, you will want to play again just to see if you missed a part of the story. Seeing City 17 at the start, as a calm city dominated by the combine, to seeing it again later, and seeing the combine's expansion, and their fall. It just kicks ass. I won't spoil anything else from the story. 

I'l be honest. The graphics don't match up to today's graphics. But the facial animation, the realism in the faces, it's just awesome considering it was released in 2004. The physics engine is source, ofcourse. Do I need to say more? Probably not, it's awesome. 

Trust me, if you want a FPS with puzzle elements and the best story you've ever seen in video-gaming, get Half life 2.

Half-Life 2 is a first-person shooter game from Valve. It is a sequel to the previous game, Half-Life.

The game focus on storyline set after the event of Half-Life, in a City 17 somewhere in Eastern Europe. You play as Gordon Freeman, the protagonist from Half-Life and embark on a new journey as he return from G-man stasis. The world that he once knew has changed, the Combine has taken over. Now he must struggle along with his fellow human resistance for survival.

Using the new Source Engine, Half-Life 2 has remarkable graphics and far better than the previous Half-Life game. The new physics are incredible, almost everything is moveable. Textures and effects are also even more beautiful. The best graphics of the time.

It's a good classic first-person shooter game with the best story, I recommend this.

Rating 10/10
